snippet: Mark Greenberg testified that in 2009, former Gov. John G. Rowland of Connecticut suggested that he be hired as an adviser and paid with money funneled from outside the campaign.
abstract: Mark Greenberg, real estate investor from Litchfield, Conn, who is running for Congress for third time, testifies on opening day of corruption trial of former Gov John G Rowland; Greenberg describes being pressured by Rowland, who has already served prison time for earlier conviction, to hire Rowland and pay him through concealed means.
lead_paragraph: Mark Greenberg testified that in 2009, former Gov. John G. Rowland of Connecticut suggested that he be hired as an adviser and paid with money funneled from outside the campaign.

headline.main: House Candidate Testifies of Pressure to Hire Rowland for Campaign
headline.print_headline: House Candidate Testifies of Pressure From Rowland
